body.name: Create Your Own Graphic Novel: A Guide for Kids: Write and Draw Your Own Book

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #27,506 in Books (See Top 100 in Books) #43 in Children's Composition & Creative Writing Books #75 in Children's Drawing Books (Books) #582 in Children's Comics & Graphic Novels (Books)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Everything kids ages 8 to 12 need to start creating their own comics Offering an illustrated guide, practice exercises, and pre-made comic pages, this is the most complete comic creation package for kids. Help young artists and writers explore their creative side as they make their own amazing graphic novels.

Teach kids about fundamental comic concepts, like: PANELING AND PAGE LAYOUT Discover how the shape and placement of panels control the flow of time and action. SPEECH BUBBLES AND SOUND EFFECTS Learn how silent comic pages can fill the imagination with sounds and voices. PENCILS AND INKS See how a comic progresses from the first sketches on the page to a complete picture.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My kid loves it!
reviews.reviewText: My kiddo is obsessed with graphic novels and has used this book daily since getting it on Christmas. She is now drawing things independently in the comic style and loves referencing this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent guide for the beginning graphic novel or comic writer and illustrator
reviews.reviewText: This book will definitely help the first-time writer or illustrator. Useful tips on how to create a graphic book or comic. The author/illustrator has a great sense of humor when he presents his suggestions. Nice layout templates.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gift recipient loved it.
reviews.reviewText: We got this for a graphic novel fan. 8 year old loved creating her own stories. Plenty of room to draw and write. Use colored pencils not markers as they bleed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I give it four stars... the Comic Book reader in the household was a bit less impressed...
reviews.reviewText: This book has a variety of panel layouts, gives a guide on how to lay out your panels -- showing how panels are read, which direction, which one first, giving a lot of interesting guidelines/suggestions/thoughts on what artists are doing as they are laying out a Comic Book or Graphic novel.This isn't about how to draw a person... but how to use this medium with the person you are drawing... how to do speech bubbles, how to think through the panels... a lot of stuff that kids who love reading comics and enjoying drawing could learn a lot from.I do wish it was easier to remove the pages and "shuffle the order" of the layouts once a story was in mind... but... that might be asking for a lot from a bound book.When I showed this to the Comic Book Reader in the family (and long time collector) he mentioned that some of the panel layouts were not ones he saw very often and were not ones he would suggest for a first time artist, some were challenging to fit in, some were challenging to clearly show the reader how to move between. I was intrigued by that feedback, but as the non-Comic Reader, trying to encourage a child's interest... I wasn't sure what to do with the information.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this as an option for a ‘Comic Camp’ textbook/workbook I’ll be teaching this summer.. the organization I teach for ended up ordering a copy for each student and we will do the same next year! It’s the perfect Graphic Novel 101 book. I’d say ideal for ages 8-12 (or age 34 because it was also perfect for me).. lots of blank pages/panels of varying formats in the back of the book! Lots!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for my son who loves to read and write stories. I can’t wait to see what he comes up with!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Granddaughter of 10 loved this book!
reviews.reviewText: My granddaughter who just turned 10, loves to read Graphic Novels. She also loves to draw her own graphic novels. She loved this book, which we got her for her birthday!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My 9 year old LOVED this!
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for kids who are into graphic novels, such as Dog Man, and want to create their own.

Although the preview pictures are good in kindle. Once I got the book, I was very disappointed there was no real example contents or directions. I expected more for the price. If I wanted comic panels I’d make or download them not buy a book with more of those than content.
